intro: Acer okamotoi, commonly known as the Okamoto maple, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the autumn. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It typically grows to a height of 8–12 meters and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its limited natural range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
